Package slogo.compiler

Class SLogoFunction

java.lang.Object
slogo.compiler.token.SLogoToken
slogo.compiler.WorkspaceEntry
slogo.compiler.token.SLogoFunction
All Implemented Interfaces:
SLogoRunnable
Direct Known Subclasses:
SLogoUserDefinedFunction
public class SLogoFunction
extends WorkspaceEntry
implements SLogoRunnable
A Function is a Token than extends SLogoRunnable and WorkspaceEntry. Contains a collection of Token objects. This object can also be added as an entry into the Workspace. This object is runnable and can recursively call other runnable types.

  • Field Details

    • runnableCommandList

      protected java.util.List<SLogoCommand> runnableCommandList

  • Constructor Details

    • SLogoFunction

      public SLogoFunction​(java.lang.String name)
      All Tokens must be initialized with a name, which is almost always the contents of the String that is being converted into a Token. For Function objects, this name will act as the name of the function.
      Parameters:
      name - - the specified name of the Token

    • SLogoFunction

      public SLogoFunction​(SLogoCommand initCommand, java.util.Deque<SLogoToken> parameterTokens) throws SLogoException
      Compiler is responsible for ensuring that the first Token given to the Function is a Command since SLogo syntax dictates that all user interactions are in the form of commands
      Parameters:
      initCommand - - the first command intended to be run
      parameterTokens - - a list of all remaining tokens in the user-entered String
      Throws:
      SLogoException - - if there is invalid syntax in the command

  • Method Details

    • parseParameterTokens

      private void parseParameterTokens​(SLogoCommand initCommand, java.util.Deque<SLogoToken> parameterTokens) throws SLogoException
      Throws:
      SLogoException

    • addParams

      public void addParams​(java.util.Collection<SLogoToken> params)
      Adds the passed Token to the collection of parameters. This is used to create WorkspaceEntry objects of parameters of the function. When the function is run, these WorkspaceEntry objects are set to the values that are passed to them.
      Parameters:
      params - a Collection of parameter names.

    • isReady

      public boolean isReady()
      Description copied from interface: SLogoRunnable
      Indicates whether a SLogoRunnable is ready to be run based on whether it has the correct parameters. A runnable is initialized with no parameters by the Parser class, but the Function class will continuously call isReady() on each of its runnable objects and give them parameters until they are ready to be run.
      Specified by:
      isReady in interface SLogoRunnable
      Returns:
      - true if the given parameters match the expected number and type(s), false otherwise

    • giveNextExpectedToken

      public boolean giveNextExpectedToken​(SLogoToken token)
      Description copied from interface: SLogoRunnable
      Gives the runnable the next Token it expects as a parameter. For example, the fd command expects a constant or variable, so calling this method with one of those Token types will cause isReady() to return true and allow the command to be properly run. By contract, it is the Function class's responsibility to call this method with a proper Token type (i.e. by wrapping return values from a command into a Constant object).
      Specified by:
      giveNextExpectedToken in interface SLogoRunnable
      Parameters:
      token - - a Token expected by the Command as a parameter

    • run

      public SLogoToken run()
      Calls run() recursively to take care of nested SLogoRunnables. If runnable.isReady() is true, call run() on the it and return the return value. If runnable is not ready, call getNextToken() and check what type of token it is. If it is type Constant or Variable, pass it to the SLogoRunnable using runnable.giveNextExpectedToken() and make recursive run(runnable) call on it again. If the next token is a generic Token, check the Workspace and get the concrete token type. If the type is SLogoRunnable, make recursive run() call on the inner runnable, passing the return value to the outer runnable using runnable.giveNextExpectedToken().
      Specified by:
      run in interface SLogoRunnable
      Returns:
      the return value of the last runnable object, wrapped as a Constant token.
